messages.content: ComfyUI_smZNodes is a selection of custom nodes for ComfyUI, including CLIP Text Encode++ and Settings nodes.
What is the purpose of the CLIP Text Encode++ node in ComfyUI_smZNodes?

The CLIP Text Encode++ node in ComfyUI_smZNodes can generate identical embeddings from stable-diffusion-webui for ComfyUI, allowing reproduction of the same images generated from stable-diffusion-webui on ComfyUI.
Which parsers are available in the CLIP Text Encode++ node?
The available parsers in the CLIP Text Encode++ node are: comfy, comfy++, A1111, full, compel, and fixed attention.
What is the purpose of the Settings node in ComfyUI_smZNodes?
The Settings node in ComfyUI_smZNodes is a dynamic node that functions similar to the Reroute node and is used to fine-tune results during sampling or tokenization.
ComfyUI_smZNodes can be installed via ComfyUI Manager, cloning the repository directly into the extensions directory, or downloading the project manually.
ComfyUI_smZNodes can be updated via ComfyUI Manager or by pulling the latest changes from the repository.
What are some tips to get reproducible results on both stable-diffusion-webui and ComfyUI?

To get reproducible results on both stable-diffusion-webui and ComfyUI, use the same seed, sampler settings, RNG (CPU or GPU), clip skip (CLIP Set Last Layer), and adjust the unipc configuration accordingly on both UIs.
